sections.title: Hotel Housekeeping Housekeeping - Introduction
sections.content:
'I consider housekeeping to be the heart of hotels and it is only when something goes wrong that it is recognized - just like our hearts.'

The housekeeping department, in any hotel business, contributes to major amount of profit though  it  is  considered  as  an  ancillary  service.  The  simple  reason  being,  a  customer demands a clean, tidy, and pleasing ambience.

Housekeeping generates the first impression on a guest's mind. The housekeeping efforts clearly show how the hotel will take care of its guests.
sections.summary: Housekeeping is the heart of hotels, contributing significantly to profits by providing a clean and pleasant ambiance, creating a lasting first impression on guests.

sections.title: What is Housekeeping?
sections.content: Housekeeping means performing all the duties towards cleaning, maintaining orderliness, and running a house or a business property. In case of hotels, the housekeeping duties involve maintaining the hotel to the best possible state in terms of cleanliness, and keeping it at highly desirable ambience.
sections.summary: Housekeeping involves cleaning, maintaining order, and running a property, ensuring cleanliness and a desirable ambiance, particularly in hotels.

sections.title: Objectives of Hotel Housekeeping
sections.content:
The main objectives of hotel housekeeping are:

To  understand  the  expanse  or  scope  of  housekeeping,  it  is  better  to  understand  the divisions of hotel a hotel, first.
sections.summary: The main objectives of hotel housekeeping involve understanding its scope and the divisions of a hotel.

sections.title: Divisions of a Hotel
sections.content: There are various divisions (or departments) of a hotel. They are given below.
sections.summary: A hotel has multiple divisions or departments, which are outlined below.

sections.title: Front Office
sections.content:
It  is  responsible  for  guest  check-in  and  check-out,  mail  and  information  services,  and concierge  services  such  as  tour  booking,  reserving  theatre  and  restaurants,  providing airport taxi service, etc.

<!-- image -->
sections.summary: The section describes front desk services, including check-in, mail, information, and concierge services like tour booking and transportation arrangements.

sections.title: Food and Beverage
sections.content: Food and Beverage department is responsible for preparing menus, foods, and managing inventory  of  food  and  beverage  items.  It  includes  food  and  beverage  preparation  and service for restaurant, lounge, coffee shops, bars, parties, and room service.
sections.summary: The Food and Beverage department prepares menus, manages inventory, and provides service for various outlets, including restaurants and room service.

sections.title: Uniformed Service Department
sections.content: It includes parking and door attendants, drivers, porters, and bell attendants.
sections.summary: Hotel staff includes parking and door attendants, drivers, porters, and bell attendants, providing various support services.

sections.title: Housekeeping
sections.content: Housekeeping includes the duties of keeping the areas of the hotel clean, tidy, hygienic, and pleasant. It also performs the duties pertaining to decoration of hotel premises.
sections.summary: Housekeeping maintains hotel cleanliness, hygiene, and tidiness, and decorates premises.

sections.title: Sales and Marketing
sections.content: All sales, services, advertising, promotions, and public relations are taken care of by this team.
sections.summary: The team handles sales, services, and marketing efforts, including advertising, promotions, and public relations.

sections.title: Security
sections.content: Security manager and security workers work to keep the property safe and secured from external hazards.
sections.summary: Security personnel work to protect the property from external hazards, ensuring a safe and secure environment.

sections.title: Accounts
sections.content: It conducts all financial activities like producing bills and receiving payments, computing employees' compensations and delivering payments. They also carry out the activities such as compiling monthly and annual income statements, depositing and securing cash, and controlling and monitoring assets.
sections.summary: It handles financial activities, including bill production, payment receipt, and employee compensation. Additionally, it compiles financial statements and controls assets.

sections.title: Maintenance
sections.content: The Maintenance department is responsible for the maintenance of the property. It takes care of repairing furniture and fixtures, and painting the required area. When the hotel is small, these works are contracted from an outside agency.
sections.summary: The Maintenance department handles property repairs, including furniture and fixtures, and painting. In small hotels, these tasks may be outsourced to an external agency.

sections.title: Engineering and Technology
sections.content: It is responsible for keeping all of its equipment operational. The duties include maintaining telephone,  hotel  management  software,  internet  etc.  It  is  also  responsible  for implementing any new changes required such as upgrading the software and hardware.
sections.summary: Maintains and upgrades equipment, including phones, software, and internet, to ensure operational efficiency and implement new changes as required.

sections.title: Human Resource Department
sections.content:
Human Resource department is responsible for interviewing and recruiting qualified staff to be placed at appropriate positions. They also conduct exit interviews for the employees who wish to quit the work. HRD works to set wages and salaries based on regional market rates  and  ensures  that  the  hotel  business  meets  safety  and  health  administration standards.

<!-- image -->

In  all  these  departments,  the  efforts  of  housekeeping  department  are  overt.  They  are directly  visible  to  the  guests  even  before  they  try  food  or  avail  other  amenities. Housekeeping creates the first impression about the hotel in the guests' minds. Hence this department can be said as the heart of the hotel business.
sections.summary: The HR department handles staff recruitment, wages, and safety standards. Meanwhile, the housekeeping department creates a lasting first impression on guests, making it a crucial part of the hotel business.

sections.title: Hotel Housekeeping Housekeeping - Principles
sections.content:
'There  are  practical  little  things  in  housekeeping  which  no  man  really understands.'

There are various principles followed by the housekeeping staff. They are cleaning and hygiene  principles,  safety  and  security  principles,  comfort  and  privacy  principles,  and finally, the decor. For understanding the housekeeping principles, first let us go through what advantages it offers to the hotel.
sections.summary: Housekeeping involves practical tasks that men often don't understand, following principles like cleaning, safety, and decor to provide advantages to hotels.

sections.title: Advantages of Housekeeping
sections.content:
Here are some prominent advantages, the housekeeping department offers to its guests:

Having seen the advantages, let us see the principles of housekeeping towards providing these to the guests while working safely.
sections.summary: The housekeeping department offers several advantages to guests, including a safe and comfortable stay, and now we'll explore the principles behind providing these benefits while ensuring staff safety.

sections.title: Purpose of Cleaning
sections.content: Cleaning is conducted to remove harmful bacteria present in the dust deposited on the hotel property because of air pollution. This may cause unhealthy effects on the working staff as well as the guests. Cleanliness reduces the threat of any infections and  offers comfortable stay to the guests in the hotel.
sections.summary: Cleaning in hotels removes harmful bacteria from dust, reducing the risk of infection and creating a comfortable stay for guests and a healthy environment for staff.

sections.title: Knowing and Handling Small Fire Hazards
sections.content:
The housekeeping staff needs to know various types of fires and fire extinguishers. The staff must be trained to handle small fires.

Fire is classified into the following types:

<!-- image -->
sections.summary: Housekeeping staff must be trained on fire types and extinguishers to handle small fires, with fire classified into several types to ensure effective response.

sections.title: Fire Extinguishers
sections.content:
Soda Acid extinguisher is used to put out class A fire. It sprays the compound with gaseous pressure. Only good for small intensity fires. For large intensity and widely spread fire, water must be sprayed directly on the affected area with high pressure through the hoses.

For putting out class B fires, Carbon Di-Oxide extinguishers are used. Carbon Di-Oxide fog extinguishers are well-places in case of small class C fires.

The housekeeping staff must place appropriate extinguishers near the fire prone areas and must know to operate them under challenging conditions.
sections.summary: Soda acid extinguishers are used for small Class A fires, while carbon dioxide extinguishers are used for Class B and small Class C fires.

sections.title: Importance of Décor in Housekeeping
sections.content:
The housekeeping staff is responsible for creating pleasant ambience in the hotel. This needs aesthetic sense and an eye for detail. A guest is keen to visit the hotel if he finds classy and catchy ambience with fresh air.

Housekeeping staff must intelligently use artificial waterfalls, large vases with neat and eye-catching flower arrangements, paintings, wall pieces, murals, lighting with appropriate luminance, candles, electric lamps or any rare antic pieces.

The housekeeping staff is required to know various materials such as wood, organic and artificial fibers, stone, sand, glass, plastic, and pigments to maintain the expensive hotel property.

Hotel decors can be conducted thematically depending on the local/international prominent festivals and cultures. Décor is yet another important task that elevates guests' experience with the hotel.
sections.summary: Hotel housekeeping staff create a pleasant atmosphere using aesthetic elements like decor, lighting, and arrangements to attract guests and elevate their experience.

sections.title: Hotel Housekeeping Housekeeping - Types of Hotels and Rooms
sections.content:
'Chilling out on the bed in your hotel room watching television while wearing your own pajamas, is sometimes the best part of your vacation.'

Housekeeping is the primary task the hotels need to cater for while providing service to its guests. The hotel management and especially executive of housekeeping department must ensure that the housekeeping functions are performed well in the hotel irrespective of the target guest type, size of hotel, and its location.

The guest rooms are the primary source of hotel revenue. There are higher chances of retaining the guests if the guest rooms are absolutely clean.
sections.summary: Hotels prioritize housekeeping to ensure clean guest rooms, a key factor in retaining guests and generating revenue.

sections.title: Types of Hotels
sections.content: The hotels can be categorized depending upon their size, location, target market, and ownership.
sections.summary: Hotels can be categorized based on size, location, target market, and ownership.

Hotels are categorized by the number of rooms to which service is provided. For example:

B&B and Self Catering hotels are generally family owned hotels and are not governed or run by corporate policies and procedures.

A chain of hotels or group of hotels such as Taj, Ramada, can have management affiliation with their other properties in the same group. They strictly are governed by predetermined policies.
sections.summary: B&B and self-catering hotels are typically family-owned, while chain hotels like Taj or Ramada are governed by corporate policies and procedures.

sections.content: The star rating system is a guideline for a customer that denotes what to expect from the hotel service at the time of booking. However, there is no clear distinguishing method to divide hotels into various star rating categories till today; but a guest can assume that more the number of stars, more is the luxury provided by the hotel.
sections.summary: The star rating system guides customers on hotel service expectations, with more stars indicating greater luxury, despite lacking a clear distinguishing method.

sections.title: Hotel Housekeeping Housekeeping - Cleanings
sections.content:
'Spring cleaning doesn't have to be a dreaded list of chores. It can be a rewarding experience that helps provide some structure and organization in your life.'

Cleaning  is  one  of  the  major  tasks  the  housekeeping  force  performs.  It  carries  out cleanings when the guests are about to occupy their room, while they are staying in the hotel, and immediately after the guests vacate the room. The housekeeping also cleans the public area, which is often shared by a large number of guests.
sections.summary: Housekeeping performs cleaning tasks, including room preparation and public area maintenance, to provide a clean environment for hotel guests.

sections.title: Cleaning the Check-In Room
sections.content:
The Check in rooms are cleaned when the guest is about to occupy the room. A checklist of  room  readiness  is  shared  between  the  guest  room  supervisor  and  the  guest  room attendants. The supervisor inspects the readiness of the room for occupancy.

The guest room attendant performs the following cleanings:
sections.summary: Guest rooms are cleaned before occupancy, using a shared checklist between supervisors and attendants to ensure readiness.

sections.title: Cleaning an Occupied Room
sections.content:
<!-- image -->

The  room  is  cleaned  when  the  guest  is  occupying  the  room.  It  includes  cleaning  and keeping all occupied rooms twice per day on guests' requests and convenience.
sections.summary: Room cleaning is done twice daily, upon guest request, while they occupy the room, including cleaning and maintenance.

sections.title: Cleaning the Check-Out Room
sections.content: This cleaning is performed when the guest vacates the guest room and proceeds for hotel check-out formalities. The cleaning involves:
sections.summary: Cleaning occurs after a guest checks out, involving various tasks to prepare the room for new occupants.

sections.title: Periodic Cleaning in Hotel
sections.content:
The task of cleaning is very exhausting. It is divided among a number of housekeeping staff  depending  upon  expertise.  Some  cleaning  such  as  occupied  guest  room  cleaning requires to be carried out twice on daily basis. The check-in and check-out cleanings are little less frequent.

Further, the cleaning of air-conditioner and refrigerator is less frequent. Thus, depending upon frequency of use of a particular area or device, the frequency of cleaning varies.

<!-- image -->
sections.summary: House cleaning is exhausting and divided among staff based on expertise, with frequencies varying by area or device, from daily to less often.

sections.title: Spring Cleaning
sections.content:
This type of cleaning is practiced in the hotels located in cold as well as warm regions. The name depicts  cleaning  the  house  in  the  first  few  warm  days  of  spring  when  there  is adequate sunlight to reach the corners and the floors of the room. The areas, which are not much accessed, are also cleaned during the Spring Cleaning.

Spring cleaning is generally performed once a year by moving furniture and cleaning the guest rooms entirely for dust, stains, broken furniture, and garbage. It is also called as Deep Cleaning as it is ensured that no portion of the area is left uncleaned.
sections.summary: Spring cleaning is a yearly, thorough cleaning of hotel rooms, typically done when sunlight can reach all areas, involving moving furniture to clean dust, stains, and garbage.

sections.title: Cleaning and Keeping Public Areas of Hotel
sections.content: The public areas are shared commonly among guests. They include:
sections.summary: Public areas are shared among guests, including common spaces.

sections.title: Keeping Front office, Lobby, and Corridors
sections.content: Front Office and Lobby is highly frequented. It must be clean at all hours of the day. The housekeeping staff needs to clean desks, fans, ceiling, chairs, and computers. The staff also cleans and disinfects the telephone devices, keyboards, flooring, corridors, and glass doors at the entrance of the lobby.
sections.summary: The Front Office and Lobby require constant cleaning by housekeeping staff, including desks, equipment, and high-touch areas like telephones and keyboards.

sections.title: Keeping the Dining Area
sections.content: The dining area is the next most frequently visited area. The housekeeping staff puts in good efforts for lighting, chandeliers, and cleaning the ceiling, furniture, and décor items. It also includes spreading the clean dining linen on the dining tables and keeping the floor clean. It is generally done when the area is not busy.
sections.summary: The dining area is regularly cleaned by housekeeping staff, who maintain lighting, furniture, and décor, and keep the floor and linens clean, typically when the area is not busy.

sections.title: Cleaning the Lifts
sections.content: The house keeping staff cleans lifts preferably early morning to avoid rush for use. They stop it at the ground floor, its doors are kept open, and it is then cleaned starting from top and working towards bottom.
sections.summary: Housekeeping staff clean lifts in the early morning, stopping at the ground floor with doors open, and cleaning from top to bottom to avoid disruptions.

sections.title: Cleaning the Swimming Pools
sections.content: Cleaning of the swimming pools is highly required during summer. It can be conducted by the hotel if it has an in-house expertise, or it can be contracted with an agency. Cleaning of swimming pool involves catching any leaves, purifying the pool water, and cleaning the areas surrounding the pool; including shower and changing rooms.
sections.summary: Pool cleaning is crucial in summer. It involves removing leaves, purifying water, and cleaning surrounding areas, and can be done in-house or contracted out.

sections.title: Cleaning and Keeping the Hotel Garden
sections.content: These days, the hotels keep their private team of gardeners. Watering and trimming the trees and shrubs, fertilizing the plants, raking the fall leaves, and Arbosculpture (an art of shaping trees into wonderful shapes), is taken care by this team.
sections.summary: Hotels maintain private gardening teams to care for trees, shrubs, and plants, including watering, trimming, and shaping through Arbosculpture.

sections.title: Cleaning the Parking Area
sections.content:
It  mostly involves hard sweeping the parking space, removing the cobwebs under the parking shades, and putting up appropriate guiding signs.

<!-- image -->
sections.summary: Cleaning the parking area involves sweeping, removing cobwebs, and installing guiding signs to maintain a safe and organized space.

'My father was a general manager with Hyatt, so we lived in the hotel so he would be close by if there were any problems. My mum was always adamant about us not abusing it. So I still had to clean my room. Housekeeping would never come and do it.'

-Dianna Agron, American Actress, Singer, and Dancer.

The  housekeeping  staff  needs  to  clean  various  guest  rooms,  guest  bathrooms,  and  a number of public areas in the hotel. The staff needs to take the help of various cleaning equipment while trying to keep the hotel premises to the highest standard of appearance.

Today, there is a wide range of cleaning products available in the market.
sections.summary: Dianna Agron's childhood experience living in a hotel, due to her father's job, taught her discipline, as her mother ensured she cleaned her own room despite housekeeping staff being available.

sections.title: Hotel Housekeeping Housekeeping - Linen Maintenance
sections.content:
'The best way to find yourself is to lose yourself in the service of others.'

In the range of small to large hotels, the guest room linen, guest bathroom linen, staff uniforms, all continue to accumulate in large amount. It is essential for the housekeeping staff to launder the linen and make it readily available at all times so that the staff can receive their well-laundered uniforms before work, and the guests are provided with good quality linen.

It is definitely required to purchase good quality linen; but the life, appearance, and the quality  of  linen  largely  depends  upon  the  treatment  it  receives  at  the  laundry  by  the laundry  staff.  Small  hotels  can  contract  with  the  commercial  laundry  services  located outside the hotel. Large hotel establishments prefer to install their private on-premises laundry. Let us understand on-premises laundry operated by housekeeping:
sections.summary: Housekeeping staff manage linen and uniforms, ensuring they are laundered and available. Quality linen is crucial, but its lifespan depends on laundry staff treatment, with options including on-premises laundry or external commercial services.

sections.content:
